title: Community Shield reaction as Crystal Palace beat Liverpool on penalties
description: All the reaction and analysis as Crystal Palace beat Liverpool on penalties at Wembley to win the Community Shield.
content:
Penalty hero Henderson helps Palace to another trophy
Yes, FA Cup holders Crystal Palace beat Premier League champions Liverpool at Wembley on Sunday, winning the Community Shield 3-2 on penalties following a 2-2 draw.

title: Musk's Tesla applies to supply power to British households
description: If approved by the energy watchdog Ofgem, it would allow the US firm to take on the UK's dominant suppliers.
content:
Ofgem can take up to nine months to process applications for energy supply licences.
Tesla Electric already operates a power supplier in Texas that allows owners of its EVs to charge their cars cheaply and pays them for feeding surplus electricity ba... [977 chars]

title: Russell T Davies blames Reform and Trump for decline in UK gay rights
description: Screenwriter known for reviving Doctor Who and writing Queer As Folk says LGBT community needs to fight back
content:
Russell T Davies has said gay rights are “rapidly and urgently getting worse” thanks to the rise of Reform UK and the influence of the Trump presidency on British politics.
The award-winning screenwriter, who is best known for reviving Doctor Who and... [4031 chars]

title: Conch blowing could help to alleviate sleep apnoea, study suggests
description: Experts on condition affecting millions of people in UK give cautious welcome to findings but say more research needed
content:
Blowing into a conch shell could help tackle the symptoms of a sleep disorder that affects millions of people across the UK, according to a study.
Conch blowing, also known as shankh blowing, is an ancient ritual that involves breathing in deeply and... [2692 chars]

title: British backpacker pleads guilty after fatally crashing into a father while under influence of alcohol in Australia
description: The charge of dangerous driving causing death carries a maximum penalty of 20 years in jail - and Alicia Kemp will next appear in court on 31 October.
content:
An English backpacker has pleaded guilty after fatally crashing into a father of two while riding an e-scooter under the influence of alcohol in Australia.
